ProjectTitle: Finiteness properties in infinite-dimensional algebraic geometry
InitialFeedbackHistory:
05/06/2024
Dear,
The information in this DMP is too incomplete. 
The products of your mathematical reasoning and thinking, such as f.i. proofs or theorems, are considered to be your data.
It is common practice among mathematicians to enter the articles containing the proofs of theorems and other products of their thinking as data in the data summary. That is perfectly acceptable. 

Best to add one line to the datatable in the FWO-template, for example:
Dataset Name: Theorems (or however you like to describe you results)
Description: purely theoretical mathematical reasonings and proofs contained in published articles (or whatever description you prefer)
New or reused: Generate new data
Digital or Physical: Digital
Digital Data Type: Other
Digital Data Formatl: .pdf
Digital data volume: NA.

As far as documentation is concerned, you could refer to the articles as containing all necessary documentation needed to understand your results. 
As far as metadata are concerned: if the journal uses the Mathematics Subject Classification (MSC), then just mention that as metadata. It’s even a metadata standard.
As far as sharing and preservation are concerned, I would refer to the journals for preservation to Lirias for sharing. Uploads in arXiv are only considered as open access by the funders if they are peer reviewed versions of the articles.

We advise to always answer all questions, if only by “No” or “Irrelevant”. For the questions about responsibilities at the end of the DMP it should be possible to refer to yourself and/or your PI.

Best regards,

Mark Verbrugge
label: not good
